meta.name: init_dimensions
meta.purpose: Set the dimensions of a bitmap.

param.name: width
param.desc: The width, in pixels, of this bitmap.

param.name: height
param.desc: The height, in pixels, of this bitmap.

param.name: depth
param.desc: The depth, in pixels, of this bitmap. For a simple 2D bitmap, this value is set to one. Using a depth larger than one creates a 3D bitmap. A depth of zero is invalid.

desc.para: This command sets the dimensions of a bitmap node. The dimensions must be set before layers can be created, so this is often the first command sent to a freshly created bitmap.
Note that Verse bitmaps can be three-dimensional; a separate size value is given for each of the three dimensions.
A size cannot be zero, since that would cause the total "volume" of pixels in the bitmap to be zero as well. The minimum value for a size is thus 1.

meta.name: layer_create
meta.purpose: Create a new bitmap data layer.

param.name: name
param.desc: The name of the layer to create.

alias.desc: Setting the name to an empty string identifies the command as the alias form.

param.name: type
param.desc: The type of pixel data to be stored in this layer.

desc.para: This command destroys a bitmap layer. The layer is identified by the numerical ID only, the name part is set to an empty string in order to identify the command, which is an alias.

This command creates a new bitmap layer. Bitmap layers are the actual data containers provided by the bitmap node; all bitmap data is stored in layers. Each layer has the exact dimensions of the node as a whole; for 3D bitmap nodes this means that each layer is a full three-dimensional array of pixels.

meta.name: layer_subscribe
meta.purpose: Start subscribing to a data layer.

param.name: level
param.desc: The mipmap level to which subscription should be. Level 0 is the "base" level, and has the full resolution of the node. Level 1 has one-eigth the resolution (half in each dimension), and so on. Editing is only allowed at level 0, so a client that intends to send bitmap data should probably subscribe there.

alias.desc: Requesting this level causes the command to be interpreted as the alias.

meta.name: layer_unsubscribe
meta.purpose: Stop subscribing to a data layer.

meta.name: layer_set_tile
meta.purpose: Set pixel values for a square tile of a layer.

params.address:
&nodeid; &layerid;
tile_x uint16 The x-coordinate of this tile of pixels. Tile (0,0) is the tile in the upper-left corner of a bitmap layer, tile (1,0) is the next one to the right, and so on. Pixel (0,0) of tile (1,0) is pixel (4,0) of the bitmap as a whole.
tile_y uint16 The y-coordinate for this tile of pixels.
z uint16 The z-coordinate for this tile of pixels.

param.name: type
param.desc: The type of data to set. This is repeated, since it cannot be assumed that the communications layer has buffered this information from the layer creation command.

param.name: data
param.desc: The actual pixel data. The union holds an array of 16 pixels (in the relevant format), that are interpreted as the contents of a 4x4 pixel square. Pixels are listed in row-major order. For 1-bit-per-pixel data, the entire data payload is a single uint16. See the VNBTile type description for details.

desc.para: This command transfers a tile's worth (4x4 pixels) of pixel data into a bitmap layer. The addressed pixels are simply overwritten with the new data, no compositing is supported.
